item.title: Valis: The Fantasm Soldier Collection for PC now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/10/valis-the-fantasm-soldier-collection-for-pc-now-available

  • PC

Get the whole collection, with soundtrack and art book, for $31.95.

The PC version of Valis: The Fantasm Soldier Collection is now available for PC via Steam, developer Edia announced.

Valis: The Fantasm Soldier Collection first launched for Switch on December 9, 2021 in Japan, followed by February 10, 2022 in the west.

The PC version is a free launcher, with Valis: The Fantasm Soldier, Valis II, and Valis III available as separate downloadable content purchases for $5.99 / 700 yen each. The digital soundtrack and digital art book will also be available as downloadable content for $5.99 / 700 yen and $7.99 / 920 yen, respectively.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About Valis

The legendary side scrolling action game Valis: The Fantasm Soldier series is making a triumphant appearance on Steam! The highly popular PC Engine versions of Valis: The Fantasm Soldier, Valis II, and Valis III have been fully ported for this collection.

Key Features

  • Side-Scrolling Action – Traditional side-scrolling action. Players will adventure through various levels, battling enemies and bosses using a combination of close combat attacks and magical powers.
  • Storytelling – Valis is famous for its strong narrative elements. It combines anime-style cutscenes with the action gameplay to tell the story.
  • Anime Sprite Style – The game features vibrant, Japanese anime style sprite graphics and character designs. The visual presentation and animated cutscenes set it apart from many other action games of the 90’s.
  • Variety of Weapons and Power-Ups – Players can find various weapons and power-ups throughout the stages, allowing them to power-up Yuko’s abilities and combat skills.
  • A Popular Game with a Devoted Fanbase – Valis: The Fantasm Soldier is a side-scrolling action game originally released by Telenet Japan in 1986. Its unique setting, featuring a heroine in a sailor uniform and bikini armor battling monsters, combined with high-octane action and deep storytelling, won the hearts of many gamers.
  • The Origin of the Bishojo Game Genre – The original PC Engine versions were groundbreaking for their time, featuring animation sequences and voice acting. The game’s blend of “moe” appeal, solid action gameplay, and captivating narrative led to it being recognized as a pioneer in the bishojo game genre.
  • Additional Features for Smooth Playthroughs – While faithfully preserving the original PC Engine experience, this release adds modern conveniences such as key configuration options and a rewind feature for a smoother gameplay experience on Steam.

item.title: Disney Music Parade: Encore launches December 12 in Asia
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/10/disney-music-parade-encore-launches-december-12-in-asia

  • Switch

Supports English, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese.

Rhythm action game Disney Music Parade: Encore will launch for Switch on December 12 in Asia with English, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language support, publisher Imagineer announced.

As previously announced, Disney Music Parade: Encore is due out first on November 21 in Japan for 6,578 yen. It will support up to four players.

Here is an overview of the game, via its official website:

About

A dazzling parade of famous songs!

Play alone, with family, or with friends! Run through dazzling stages alongside famous Disney music in the rhythm action game Disney Music Parade: Encore for Switch.

Key Features

  • A Rhythm Action Game Where You Can Enjoy Famous Disney Music – Experience dazzling stages that illuminate to the rhythm of the music like a Disney theme park attraction.
  • Unlock New Songs as You Progress – There are 60 songs in total. Unlock your favorite songs as you progress through the game.
  • Play Alone or With Others – Up to four players can play together on a single console. Play at your own pace by yourself, or stir things up with family and friends. How you play is up to you!
  • Various Difficulties that Even Adults Can Enjoy – Each player can choose their own difficulty. There is even a “Shake” mode that allows children and rhythm game beginners to play by simply shaking to the rhythm.
  • Ride Collection – Collect coins to obtain “Music Rides” featuring dazzlingly depicted characters.
  • Memory Collection – Collect “light notes” to unlock “Memory Crystals” that feature famous scenes from Disney animated works.
